title: 111_hr4217
content: The "Fiscal Year 2010 Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act, Part II" extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until March 31, 2010. The amendments made by this Act take effect on January 1, 2010. The Authority section of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change the effective date to April 1, 2010, and includes the Fiscal Year 2010 Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act. The Airport Improvement Program is extended with an authorization of $2 billion for the 6-month period starting on October 1, 2009. The Airport Improvement Program is extended with an authorization of $2 billion for the 6-month period starting on October 1, 2009. Sums made available can be obligated until September 30, 2010, and remain available until expended. Funding apportionments are calculated based on an annualized basis for fiscal year 2010, with a 50 percent reduction. The funding apportionments and amounts available under specific sections of the title are extended to March 31, 2010. Various authorities under title 49, United States Code, are also extended to later dates in 2010. Section 47107(s)(3), 47115(j), 47141(f), 49108, 161, and 186(d) of title 49, United States Code, are all amended to change dates from December 31, 2009, or January 1, 2010, to March 31, 2010, or April 1, 2010. These amendments will take effect on January 1, 2010. Additionally, section 106(k)(1)(F) of the same title is amended for Federal Aviation Administration operations. Section 106(k)(1)(F) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to allocate $4,676,574,750 for the 6-month period starting on October 1, 2009. Additionally, Section 48101(a)(6) is amended to allocate $1,466,888,500 for air navigation facilities and equipment, and Section 48102(a)(14) is amended to allocate $92,500,000 for research, engineering, and development for the same 6-month period.
